definition: Schiller (name)/Johann Christoph Friedrich von Schiller or Friedrich Schiller (1759-1805), German poet and dramatist
surname Xi
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
to strap tightly/to bind
Friedrich Schiller or Johann Christoph Friedrich von Schiller (1759-1805), German poet and dramatist
pinyin: Fu2 li3 de2 li3 xi1 · Xi2 le4

sentences.english: Schiller, Goethe only in the face, only feel the need to escape out.
sentences.chinese: 席勒，也只有在歌德面前，才覺得有必要脫身而出。

sentences.english: The creations of youthful Schiller mainly have four-part drama.
sentences.chinese: 青年席勒的創作主要是四部戲劇。

sentences.english: Egon Schiele's "Death and the Maiden" illustrates humanity's relationship with death.
sentences.chinese: 埃貢席勒的“死神與少女”說明了人類與死亡的關係。

sentences.english: I don't know if he remembers this.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道在我向席勒教授解釋的時候。

sentences.english: Shiller's view of sublimity is an important part of his aesthetic theory.
sentences.chinese: 崇高思想是席勒美學理論的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: The phrase "a fellow-feeling" comes from Schiller's narrative poem Promise.
sentences.chinese: 而“人的同情感”來自於席勒的敘事詩《保證》。

sentences.english: 'The government data might be a warning, ' says Mr. Shiller.
sentences.chinese: “政府數據似乎可以看作是一個警訊，”席勒說。
